title: What musical term did radio disc jockey Alan Freed coin in 1951? - Quora

response.answer_text: No Google required. Allan Freed is best known as the creator of the term “ Rock and Roll” . Freed was a radio disc jockey and began to use the term on the air in the early 1950’s while at station WJW in Cleveland.  He described the music as quoted here : "rock and roll is a river of music which has absorbed many streams: rhythm and blues, jazz, ragtime, cowboy songs, country songs, folk songs. All have contributed greatly to the big beat." So Allan Freed is a huge part of music history. Albert James "Alan" Freed (December 15, 1921 – January 20, 1965)

I don’t know Alan Freed but I’ve heard of a DJ in the Philly area, Jerry Blavat who was called “The Geater with the Heater.” and also known as “The Big Boss with the Hot Sauce.” His radio show was from the sixties and he played the “oldies.” Blavat also appeared on local TV.
